==Events==
*[[3761 BC]] &ndash; The epoch reference date epoch (origin) of the modern [[Hebrew calendar]] ([[Proleptic Julian calendar]]).
*[[1477]] &ndash; [[Uppsala University]] is inaugurated after receiving its corporate rights from [[Pope Sixtus IV]] in February the same year.
*[[1513]] &ndash; [[Battle of La Motta]]: [[Spain|Spanish]] troops under [[Ramón de Cardona]] defeat the [[Republic of Venice|Venetians]].
*[[1542]] &ndash; Explorer [[Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo|Cabrillo]] discovers [[Santa Catalina Island, California|Santa Catalina Island]] off of the California coast.
*[[1571]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Lepanto (1571)|Battle of Lepanto]] is fought, and the [[Holy League (1571)|Holy League]] (Spain and Italy) annihilates the Turkish fleet.
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]], this day is skipped in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1691]] &ndash; The English royal charter for the [[Province of Massachusetts Bay]] is issued.
*[[1763]] &ndash; [[George III of the United Kingdom|King George III]] of [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]] issues [[British Royal Proclamation of 1763]], closing aboriginal lands in [[North America]] north and west of [[Alleghenies]] to white settlements.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Crown Prince]] [[Paul of Russia]] marries [[Sophie Marie Dorothea of Württemberg]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The Americans defeat the [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] in the Second Battle of Saratoga, also known as the [[Battle of Bemis Heights]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War &ndash; [[Battle of Kings Mountain]]: [[United States|American]] [[Patriot (American Revolution)|Patriot]] [[militia]] defeat [[Loyalist (American Revolution)|Loyalist]] [[irregular military|irregulars]] led by British major [[Patrick Ferguson]] in [[South Carolina]].
*[[1800]] &ndash; [[French corsairs|French corsair]] [[Robert Surcouf]], commander of the 18-gun ship ''La Confiance'', captures the British 38-gun ''Kent'' inspiring the traditional French song ''Le Trente-et-un du mois d'août''.
*[[1826]] &ndash; The [[Granite Railway]] begins operations as the first chartered railway in the U.S.
*[[1828]] &ndash; [[Morea Expedition]]: The city of [[Patras]], Greece, is liberated by the French expeditionary force in the Peloponnese under [[Nicolas Joseph Maison|General Maison]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; [[William II of the Netherlands|Willem II]] becomes King of the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Royal Columbian Hospital]] (RCH) opens as the first hospital in the [[Provinces and territories of Canada|Canadian province]] of [[British Columbia]]
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]] &ndash; [[Bahia Incident]]: {{USS|Wachusett||}} illegally captures the {{Ship|CSS|Florida|cruiser|6}} Confederate raider while in port in [[Bahia]], [[Brazil]] in violation of Brazilian neutrality.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Cornell University]] holds opening day ceremonies; initial student enrollment is 412, the highest at any American university to that date.
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]] &ndash; [[Siege of Paris (1870-1871)|Siege of Paris]]: [[Leon Gambetta]] flees [[Paris]] in a hot-air balloon.
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]] sign the "Twofold Covenant" and create the [[Dual Alliance (1879)|Dual Alliance]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The [[Helsinki Stock Exchange]] sees its first transaction.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Georgia Institute of Technology|Georgia Tech]] defeats [[Cumberland University]] 222-0 in the most [[1916 Cumberland vs. Georgia Tech football game|lopsided college football game]] in American history.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[KLM]], the [[flag carrier]] of the [[Netherlands]], is founded. It is the oldest [[airline]] still operating under its original name.
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Andreas Michalakopoulos]] becomes [[List of Prime Ministers of Greece|Prime Minister of Greece]] for a short period of time.
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[Patriarch Photios II of Constantinople|Photios II]] becomes [[Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Air France]] is inaugurated, after being formed by a merger of 5 French airlines.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: the [[McCollum memo]] proposes bringing the [[United States]] into the war in Europe by provoking the Japanese to attack the United States.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The October [[Actions along the Matanikau (September – October 1942)|Matanikau action]] on [[Guadalcanal]] begins as [[United States Marine Corps]] forces attack [[Imperial Japanese Army]] units along the [[Matanikau River]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: During an [[Auschwitz concentration camp#Birkenau revolt|uprising]] at [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Birkenau concentration camp]], Jewish prisoners burn down the crematoria.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The communist [[East Germany|German Democratic Republic]] (East Germany) is formed.
*[[1955]] &ndash; American poet [[Allen Ginsberg]] performs his poem [[Howl]] for the first time at the [[Six Gallery reading|Six Gallery]] in [[San Francisco]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[President of Pakistan]] [[Iskander Mirza]], with the support of General [[Ayub Khan (Field Marshal)|Ayub Khan]] and the army, suspends the 1956 constitution, imposes [[martial law]], and cancels the elections scheduled for January 1959.
*  1958   &ndash; The U.S. manned space-flight project is renamed [[Project Mercury]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union|U.S.S.R.]] probe [[Luna 3]] transmits the first ever photographs of the [[far side of the Moon]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Nigeria]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[John F. Kennedy]] signs the ratification of the [[Partial Test Ban Treaty]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Oman]] joins the United Nations.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Hua Guofeng]] becomes [[Mao Zedong]]'s successor as chairman of [[Communist Party of China]], following the latter's death barely a month earlier.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The adoption of the [[1977 Soviet Constitution|Fourth Soviet Constitution]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The ''[[MS Achille Lauro|Achille Lauro]]'' is hijacked by [[Palestine Liberation Organization]].
*  1985   &ndash; The [[Mameyes]] landslide kills close to 300 in the worst landslide in North American history.
*[[1987]] &ndash; Sikh nationalists declares the independence of [[Khalistan]] from India; it is not internationally recognized.
*[[1988]] &ndash; An [[Inupiat people|Inupiaq]] hunter discovers three [[gray whale]]s trapped under the ice in [[Barrow, Alaska]], US; the situation becomes [[Operation Breakthrough|a multinational effort to free the whales]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Croatian War of Independence]]: [[Bombing of Banski dvori]] in [[Zagreb]] kills 1 civilian.
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[Great Flood of 1993|flood of '93]] ends at [[St. Louis, Missouri]], 103 days after it began, as the [[Mississippi River]] falls below flood stage.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Fox News Channel]] begins [[broadcasting]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Matthew Shepard]], a gay student at the [[University of Wyoming]], is found tied to a fence after being savagely beaten by two young adults in [[Laramie, Wyoming]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|U.S. invasion of Afghanistan]] begins with an air assault and covert operations on the ground.
*[[2003]] &ndash; A historic [[California gubernatorial recall election|recall election]] takes place in the U.S. State of California in which the sitting Governor [[Gray Davis]], a Democrat, is overwhelmingly voted out of office. Actor, bodybuilder and Republican candidate [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] is elected to be the [[List of California Governors|38th Governor of California]] over fellow Republican [[Tom McClintock]] and Democrat [[Cruz Bustamante]] who at the time was the sitting Lt. Governor of California. This is the first recall election in the history of the State of California in which a sitting Governor has been successfully recalled from office.
